title: Gluttons and Alcoholics
body: With people staying home during the COVID-19 pandemic, we wanted to design an application where users could search for meals by ingredient and dietary requirements. Each meal is paired with a random drink.
technology: UIkit CSS framework, JavaScript, jQuery, Edamam Recipe API, TheCocktailDB API

title: Helping Hands
body: This application, built by a four-person team, links prospective volunteers to organizations that need their help. Volunteers can sign up for access to the site, log in and look through opportunities. They can also claim opportunities that interest them.
technology: Node.JS, Express, Handlebars, Sequelize and Bootstrap

title: Can't Top My Team
body: It can be challenging to keep track of who is working on different projects. This team generator gives managers quick access to team members and their relevant information.

title: What's the Weather
body: This is a simple weather dashboard to search for current weather conditions and a five-day forecast by city using several OpenWeather APIs. Fields include the current day's temperature, humidity, wind speed and UV index. Below those, a 5-day forecast appears that includes the temperature and humidity.

title: Workout Has noSQL
body: Logging workouts allows users to track their progress over time. In this application, users can log both resistance and cardio workouts. Users can record the name, type, weight, sets, reps, and duration of strength exercises. They can also track the distance covered of cardio exercises.

title: Note These Words
body: For people with a lot on their minds, writing notes is an excellent way to keep track of their thoughts. This application gives users a way to take notes throughout the day in their web browser.
